The '''Creative inventory''' is an interface in [[Creative]] mode that contains infinite amounts of all [[blocks]] and [[items]] in the game, some of which not available in Survival mode. Players can search for the items they want to use with the search bar at the top or in several tabs. 

== ''Java Edition'' ==
A single item can be grabbed using left-click, increasing with continued left-clicks on that item. Left or right-clicking with an item or stack of items while hovering over any item other than the one held gets rid of the held item. Right-clicking an item also picks up one item, but the second click then puts it back down as opposed to picking up more. Shift-clicking an item grabs a full stack of items. Pressing a number key while hovering over an item instantly places one full stack of that item into the hotbar slot that corresponds with the number.

The Creative inventory screen is sorted into 11 sections: ''Building Blocks'', ''Colored Blocks'', ''Natural Blocks'', ''Functional Blocks'', ''Redstone Blocks'', ''Tools & Utilities'', ''Combat'', ''Food & Drinks'', ''Ingredients'', ''Spawn Eggs'', and ''Operator Utilities''. The latter tab is available only if cheats are enabled and the "Operator Items Tab" option in the controls menu is turned on. Blocks are grouped by material and the same item can appear in multiple tabs, which the latter are indicated with an asterisk (*) below. In the case of the search tab, those that appear in multiple tabs are listed only once in the first section. There are also {{InvSprite|Compass|scale=0.5}} ''Search Items'', {{InvSprite|Bookshelf|scale=0.5}} ''[[Saved Hotbars]]'' and {{InvSprite|Chest|scale=0.5}} ''Survival Inventory'' tabs. Wither and ender dragon spawn eggs, petrified oak slab, knowledge book, uncraftable potions and uncraftable tipped arrow are not obtainable in the Creative inventory.

Using the search tab, one can access enchanted books of any level, whereas only books of the maximum levels can be found in the ''Ingredients'' section.

=== Exclusive features in ''Java Edition'' ===
{{Main|Java Edition exclusive features#Creative inventory}}<!--The content has been moved there to keep this page under size limits, as the content relates to the topic of exclusive features-->

== ''Bedrock Edition'' ==
{{Update|{{el|ee}} items}}
{{Redirect|Nature|some of the features associated with nature|Plant}}
{{Redirect|Construction|naturally generated buildings|Structure|the guide on building|Tutorial:Construction}}
The Creative inventory screen in ''Bedrock Edition'' includes three buttons at the top of the screen (along the left with Pocket UI enabled) that can be used to show the regular Creative inventory, the regular [[Inventory|Survival inventory]], or both, with the Survival inventory on the right and the Creative inventory on the left. The Survival inventory contains the same features as the regular inventory in Survival, with the armor slots, [[2Ã—2 grid|crafting grid]], and player doll. The [[recipe book]] is absent in Creative mode.

Taking items from the Creative inventory will always take a stack of items. Shift-clicking an item or tapping an item on mobile devices will send a stack of items to the first free slot in the hotbar or the Survival inventory when it is opened. Right-clicking an item will take only one item. Pressing a hotbar key while hovering over an item sends a stack to the respective hotbar slot, replacing any items inside.

When using a controller, all items in the [[hotbar]] can be instantly cleared by pressing {{xbtn|x}}/{{psbtn|tr}} in the Creative inventory. This feature can be disabled in the "[[Settings#Controller|Controller]]" settings tab.

The Creative inventory screen is sorted into 4 sections: ''Construction'', ''Equipment'', ''Items'', and ''Nature''. These 4 tabs appear along the top right of the inventory (along the right side with Pocket UI enabled).

There is also an ''All'' tab, which shows all of the items and blocks in the game and an input box that allows filtering them. Sorted items added through [[add-on]]s are always listed at the end of the page, they're also available as well at the end of the ''All'' tab.

Some items in the Creative inventory are grouped together in sub-sections with other similar items. These sub-sections can be opened by selecting the item with a '''+''' icon next to it. Selecting the sub-section with a '''-''' icon closes the subsection. These sub-sections exclusively appear in the individual 4 categories and do not appear in the ''All'' tab.

=== Exclusive items ===
There are 40 items exclusive to the ''Bedrock Edition'' Creative inventory, as follows:

* [[Wither (effect)|Decay]] effect {{ItemLink|Arrow of Decay|Tipped Arrow}}, {{ItemLink|Potion of Decay|Potion}}, {{ItemLink|Splash Potion of Decay|Splash Potion}}, and {{ItemLink|Lingering Potion of Decay|Lingering Potion}}
* {{ItemLink|Long Mundane Potion}}, {{ItemLink|Splash Long Mundane Potion}}, and {{ItemLink|Lingering Long Mundane Potion}}
* {{ItemLink|Empty Locator Map}}
* {{ItemLink|Firework Star}}, all colors
* {{ItemLink|Firework Rocket|Firework Rockets}}, all colors and one additional preset

== Unavailable blocks and items ==
There are several blocks and a couple of items that do not appear in the Creative inventory. They can be obtained with the {{Cmd|give}} command and can be manually placed using {{Cmd|setblock}} command, using the IDs provided in the table below. Additionally, using {{Control|pick block}} on these blocks also gives them, except where noted. [[Technical blocks]], such as [[portal]]s and off-state [[redstone torch]]es, do not have corresponding inventory items at all {{in|java}} and cannot be obtained without external help {{In|bedrock}}, and thus cannot be legitimately obtained.

== Creative inventory exclusives ==
{{Info needed section|- List may be incomplete, and it may be a good idea to restructure this list into a table like in the unavailable section if parity issues are found}}

Several blocks and items found in the Creative inventory are not normally available as items through vanilla Survival gameplay.

* {{BlockLink|Bedrock}}

Some of these, however, were obtainable using glitches or by exploiting quirks in certain historical versions; more information can be found in the [[mcdf:Minecraft Discontinued Features Wiki|Minecraft Discontinued Features Wiki]].

=== ''Java Edition'' ===
{{HistoryTable

|Includes all available blocks listed.}}
|{{HistoryLine|java indev}}
|{{HistoryLine||0.31|dev=20091231-2033|Removed Creative inventory.}}
|{{HistoryLine|java beta}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.8|dev=Pre-release|The Creative inventory has been readded.
|Picking up an [[item]] with a full hotbar puts it in an inventory like [[Survival]], but is hidden when viewing the Creative inventory. The only way to access the items is to {{ctrl|use}} a block with its own inventory.}}
|{{HistoryLine|java}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.3.1|dev=12w21b|The inventory button no longer closes the inventory and instead opens search tab, so the [[player]] now must press {{key|Esc}} instead.
|The [[Survival]] mode inventory is now accessible.
|Added a search tab and search function in Creative, allowing players to search for items in the Creative inventory.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=12w22a|[[Armor]] slots, [[crafting]] grid, and a delete item feature are added to the Survival inventory.
|The Search tab no longer opens automatically, unless the player presses the chat key (Default: {{key|T}}), allowing the inventory to be closed with the normal inventory key again.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=12w30c|The 2Ã—2 crafting grid was removed from the Survival inventory tab.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.4.2|dev=12w32a|Added the [[game rule]] {{cd|keepInventory}}, allowing for the retention of player inventory upon death when set to {{cd|true}}.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=12w40a|Improves inventory management.
* {{control|Pick block}} now works on blocks represented as items in the inventory (e.g. repeater, redstone dust, tripwire, etc).
* Pressing keys {{key|1}}-{{key|9}} while hovering over an item transfers it into the corresponding hotbar slot.
** if there is already an item in the assigned hotbar slot, the hotbar item and the selected item swap position.
** while in Creative item selection screen, a stack of that item is transferred to the assigned hotbar slot.
* In [[Creative]] mode, items can now be {{key|shift}}+clicked between the hotbar and the [[Survival]] inventory.
** {{control|pick block}} on an item clones and picks up a stack of that item.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.6.1|dev=13w17a|Added extra tooltip info in the search tab.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.7.2|dev=13w36a|The displayed item for the 'Decoration Blocks' tab in the Creative menu has been changed from a rose to a peony flower.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.9|dev=15w31a|The [[Survival]] inventory has been rearranged to accommodate the new off-hand slot.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.12|dev=17w06a|Added Saved Toolbars.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=17w13a|Added recipe book button to the Survival inventory.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=17w14a|Changed the icon on the trigger button from a standard book to a [[knowledge book]].}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=pre6|Optimized Creative inventory searching; namespaces (e.g minecraft:stone) are no longer considered when searching (putting "minecraft:" in the search bar still searches namespaces).}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.19.3|dev=22w42a|Major overhaul to Creative inventory, see [[Creative inventory/history]] for changes.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.21.5|dev=25w08a|The displayed item for the 'Spawn Eggs' tab in the Creative menu has been changed from a [[Pig Spawn Egg]] to a [[Creeper Spawn Egg]].}}
}}
